channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Boris Johnson defends UK Christmas bubble chaos
item.description: At a Downing Street press conference, the PM said all the UK nations were sending the 'same message' that 'smaller is safer'.

item.title: SNP MP Drew Henry is suspended from House of Commons for shouting as the Brexit bill passed
item.description: MP Drew Henry, the SNP's business spokesman, shouted 'this is an outrage' as proceedings on the UK Internal Market Bill came to a conclusion following a lengthy parliamentary battle in recent weeks.

item.title: China's Chang'e-5 capsule lands carrying the first fresh samples of moon in more than 45 years
item.description: China's Chang'e-5 probe touched down in the Siziwang district at 1:30 local time Thursday. Ground teams are investigating the capsule and will soon remove the lunar samples inside.

item.title: Wales to put two household Christmas bubble limit into law
item.description: The Welsh Government said this evening the country's guidance to limit Christmas bubbles to two households will now be made into law.

item.title: Princess Charlene of Monaco appears unrecognisable as she shows off a VERY daring haircut
item.description: Princess Charlene of Monaco appeared unrecognisable today as she attended the traditional Christmas tree ceremony at the Monaco Palace.

item.title: John Cannan's family begged him to admit to Suzy Lamplugh's murder
item.description: The brother of convicted rapist and murderer John Cannan said his sister begged the convicted killer to admit to the 1986 murder of Suzy Lamplugh, an estate agent from London.

item.title: Rod Stewart's assault charges are 'very close' to being resolved outside court, US judge is told
item.description: The musician, 75, and his son Sean, 40, were charged with simple battery against security guard Jesse Dixon at a luxury hotel in Palm Beach, Florida on New Year's Eve 2019.

item.title: Boris Johnson hints all of Kent will be KEPT in Tier Three
item.description: The PM told a Downing Street press conference tonight that Kent was still seeing a 'worrying' rise in infections and gave no indication that any local authorities could be downgraded.

item.title: UK's daily Covid cases continue to rise with 25,161 more positive tests
item.description: Today's infections mark a 51 per cent jump the 16,578 figure last Wednesday and are 36 per cent higher than the 18,450 recorded across Britain yesterday.

item.title: Johnny Depp 'blocked from making cameo' in Pirates Of The Caribbean after Disney 'balked' at idea
item.description: The major corporation distanced itself from the 57-year-old actor even before his 'wife beater' libel trial in the UK despite never formally severing ties according to The Hollywood Reporter .

item.title: Cocaine-using mother, 26, is jailed for life for murdering her 19-month-old daughter
item.description: Katie Crowder killed Gracie Crowder by pouring hot water over her at their home in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire. The 19-month-old child took an hour to die, a court heard.

item.title: Roman Abramovich's ex-wife Dasha Zhukova is expecting her first child with Stavros Niarchos
item.description: Moscow-born gallery owner and ex-wife of Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich, Dasha Zhukova, 39, is expecting her first child with billionaire shipping tycoon Stavros Niarchos, 34.

item.title: Diabetes sufferer, 34, took his own life during first lockdown, inquest hears
item.description: Daniel Furniss, 34, whose diabetes made him particularly vulnerable to coronavirus, was found dead at his home in Waterlooville, Hampshire, near Portsmouth, on March 27.

item.title: Row over planned asylum seeker camps with no electricity or water
item.description: MPs have clashed over proposed changes to the UK asylum system due to coming into force next year that one minister claims would see people put up in camps without mains electricity or water.

item.title: Alaska healthcare worker suffered serious allergic reaction from Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine
item.description: A healthcare worker in Alaska allegedly suffered a severe allergic reaction after being dosed with Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine on Tuesday and was still hospitalized as of Wednesday.

item.title: Twitter reacts to Christmas bubbles chaos as Wales and Scotland change rules
item.description: Boris Johnson has been branded a 'turkey,' online after encouraging Brits to have a 'merry little Christmas,' as Wales and Scotland tightened their guidance for families meeting next week.

item.title: Chinese embassy plans in London 'could unearth bodies of thousands of Black Death victims'
item.description: The People's Republic of China wants to use the former Royal Mint, which sits opposite the Tower of London, as its new embassy - making it the Communist country's largest in Europe.

item.title: Families of IRA Hyde Park bombing victims will fight judge's ruling
item.description: The families of the Hyde Park bombing victims have said they will challenge the decision by Mr Justice Martin Spencer not to award 'substantial damages' for the atrocity in 1982.

item.title: Kenyan member of al-Shabab is indicted for new 9/11 plot
item.description: Cholo Abdi Abdullah allegedly spent years training to carry out a 9/11-style attack; he will appear in a New York court later Wednesday.

item.title: Wife who hanged herself after 'drowning her son' feared she would 'die from likely curable cancer'
item.description: Yulia Gokcedag, 35, was found dead in Tower Hamlets, east London, on August 13, with a post-mortem giving her cause of death as hanging. Her son, Timur, seven, was found drowned in a bath.

item.title: BBC accused of lacking diversity in Archers 70th anniversary celebration
item.description: The Archers row erupted after the BBC's publicity department released the cast picture to celebrate the upcoming 70th anniversary of the programme in January.

item.title: Last two animals at run-down Pakistani zoo move out as it closes for good
item.description: Suzie and Bubloo, two Himalayan brown bears that had spent the last 13 years in captivity at a run-down Pakistani zoo, became the final animals to leave on Wednesday as it shut its doors for good.

item.title: Americans and Brits mock each other's food, from chip butties to Hershey's chocolate
item.description: An American Twitter user named Jack shared his surprise that Brits eat 'chip butties,' which he described as 'French fries in between two slices of bread.'

item.title: 'Catwoman' Jocelyn Wildensteinand fiancé Lloyd Klein hit the town in Miami
item.description: 'Catwoman' Jocelyn Wildenstein and her fashion designer fiancé Lloyd Klein got all dressed up to hit the town in Miami on Tuesday.

item.title: WHO scientists will travel to Wuhan in January to investigate origins of Covid-19
item.description: The international mission is expected to go to China in the first week of January to investigate the origins of the virus that sparked the coronavirus pandemic, has killed more than 1.6 million people.

item.title: Assistant producer, 25, on The One Show died in freak accident
item.description: Charlie Mott, described by television presenter Alex Jones as 'hugely talented,' had been celebrating with friends and taking part in drinking games at a house in Buckinghamshire when he was found dead.

item.title: French and Spanish police hunting for British hiker to meet to discuss next steps in Pyrenees search
item.description: Esther Dingley, 37, was last seen on November 22 as she made her way to the summit of the Pic de Sauveguard mountain in the Pyrenees. Bad weather has halted search efforts.

item.title: Police worker is jailed for deleting video that showed him speeding while wearing a cowboy hat
item.description: Martin Gorst, 55, who worked for North Wales Police removed video evidence and altered computer records so he and his wife could avoid penalties for speeding offences.
item.media:credit: Â© Andrew Price / View Finder Pi

item.title: George Clooney calls on the federal government to help subsidize the movie industry
item.description: George Clooney opened up about where he sees the future of film in a post COVID-19 world in an essay penned for Variety on Wednesday.

item.title: New Covid strain has 17 mutations, scientist say
item.description: Members of the UK's Covid-19 Genomics UK Consortium (COG-UK), who've been studying the variant, say they've found 17 mutations, which they described as 'a lot'.

item.title: Speeding driver, 47, is jailed for more than four years for killing schoolgirl, 13, in crash
item.description: Tony Packenham was speeding in a Land Rover Defender on a 60mph road near Carlisle, Cumbria, when the vehicle was involved in a crash with another car, containing Ingrid Messenger.

item.title: Brass band plays Fairytale of New York to raise cash for a foodbank
item.description: The New York Brass Band marched through a residential area in the Minster city to raise funds for a local foodbank while playing The Pogues' classic Farirytale of New York.

item.title: Tube map gets an upgrade: Thameslink service will be added to iconic guide
item.description: The network, which runs between Bedford and Brighton via central London, will be back on the map from next month following a long-running campaign.

item.title: Romeo jet skier, 28, who was jailed for riding across Irish Sea 'CAN'T SWIM'
item.description: Dale McLaughlan's daring 25-mile trip has also got him in trouble with his mother because he will miss Christmas with his two children in North Ayrshire because he is now in a Douglas jail.

item.title: Downing Street puts MPs on stand-by to interrupt Christmas break to vote on a Brexit deal NEXT WEEK
item.description: The President of the European Commission raised hopes of a deal being struck in the coming days as she told MEPs that progress has been made in key areas.

item.title: Earl Spencer's wife shares photos of Christmas decorations being put up at Althorp House
item.description: Charles Spencer's wife Karen (pictured, together, left) has taken to Instagram to reveal that Christmas preparations are underway at Althorp House (top inset)

item.title: Black labourer who had his genitals grabbed by boss wins £105,000 payout
item.description: Alwayne Thompson, 39, was awarded £105,000 after winning his claim of suffering racist abuse from colleagues at waste disposal company Wheeldon Brothers in Greater Manchester.

item.title: Financial advisor with a six-figure salary is humbled by unemployed mother-of-five
item.description: Alex, a 25-year-old financial advisor from Stoke-on-Trent with a six figure salary, is shocked when he goes to live with a mother-of-five on benefits for Rich Kids Go Skint on 5Star tonight.

item.title: Oxford Brookes rugby club investigated over 'pictures of naked female students'
item.description: Members of Oxford Brookes Union Rugby Football Club were allegedly asked during an online social to gather as many explicit pictures of naked female students as they could.

item.title: Dying father, 38, makes heartbreaking final call to his wife after being shot at store in Phoenix
item.description: Father-of-five Jorge Hernandez, 38, was buying milk for his baby at a Family Dollar in Phoenix when a gunman opened fire into the store from the outside.

item.title: Atomic clock: new design will be only less than a tenth of a second out after 14 BILLION years
item.description: The design by US experts makes use of a bizarre phenomenon called quantum entanglements, in which two particles become inextricably linked.

item.title: Serial rapist, 39, wore Covid mask when he attacked girl, 17
item.description: William Trotter, 39, hit his victim around the head with a blunt object, strangled her until she lost consciousness and brutally raped her in undergrowth along a street in Bromley, London.

item.title: Millions of revellers will flock to over 5,000 illegal raves and lockdown parties over New Year
item.description: This year there won't be traditional scenes of people packed into venues for the the moment the clock strikes midnight, with authorities keen to minimise crowds and limit the spread of coronavirus.

item.title: France's 'most wanted woman' jailed along with 13 others over 2015 Charlie Hebdo attack
item.description: Hayat Boumeddiene, wife of jihadi gunman Amedy Coulibaly, was among 14 people found guilty Wednesday over attacks on Charlie Hebdo and a Jewish supermarket in January 2015.
item.media:credit: © Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: Widow of PC Andrew Harper says she feels 'let down' by justice system
item.description: The sentences given to three teenagers for the manslaughter of PC Andrew Harper will not be changed after the Court of Appeal dismissed an application from the Attorney General.

item.title: Finding 'God's Land': Archaeologists analyze 3,300-year-old mummified remains to find ancient Punt
item.description: Experts looking for the lost Land of Punt, a trading partner of Ancient Egypt, analyzed 3,300-year-old mummified baboons found in Egypt with the hopes they will lead them to the exact location of Punt.

item.title: Pictured: Travelodge receptionist found bludgeoned to death in foyer is named as Spanish woman, 27
item.description: Marta Vento, 27, originally from Valencia, Spain, died of head injuries after being beaten by a killer using a blunt instrument as she worked as a receptionist at the Travelodge in Bournemouth, Dorset.

item.title: Princess Eugenie gives royal fans a glimpse into the garden at her home
item.description: Princess Eugenie, 30, appeared in a video that was shared on Twitter by Teenage Cancer Trust. The royal can be seen speaking from a garden, possibly at Ivy Cottage in Kensington Palace.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell is pictured with her husband Scott Borgerson for the first time
item.description: The photo shows them beaming while they were at the inaugural Arctic Circle assembly, a conference in Reykjavik, the capital of Iceland in October of 2013.

item.title: M&S fans rejoice as retailer launches festive Colin the Caterpillar
item.description: Marks & Spencer has delighted fans by releasing the Christmas edition of the popular Colin the Caterpillar cake. Fans across the UK rejoiced and said they were rushing to buy one in store.

item.title: Meet Wonder Woman 1984 star Lilly Aspell
item.description: She plays a young Diana in the upcoming Wonder Woman 1984 movie, which is slated for release on Wednesday.

item.title: Current vaccination speed would take UK a decade to get coronavirus jabs to everyone
item.description: UK's coronavirus vaccine deployment minister Nadhim Zahawi today announced that 137,897 people were vaccinated in the UK between December 8 and 15 - around 17,000 a day.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: What are the new rules on Christmas bubbles in the UK?
item.description: The Christmas rules relaxation has been thrown into jeopardy by rising infection rates and warnings that the freedoms would cause a spiralling death toll and the NHS to be overwhelmed.

item.title: Komodo dragon seriously wounds worker at 'Jurassic park' resort under construction in Indonesia
item.description: Elias Agas, 46, was whisked off Rinca Island by speedboat after a colossal lizard 'tore several parts of his body,' last Wednesday.

item.title: Carlton Reid discovers the joys of cycling a Roman road through Northumberland to Scotland
item.description: Carlton Reid discovers the joys of cycling the Roman Dere Street through rural Northumberland into Scotland, where he stayed in the incredible 16th-century Aikwood Tower.

item.title: Women and girls groomed by gangs and forced to sell drugs should NOT face criminal charges, CPS says
item.description: New legal guidance published by the Crown Prosecution Service aims to address the increasing number of females involved in gang-related crimes.

item.title: 'Devastated' pub bosses blast closing Tier 3 venues for Christmas
item.description: London was plunged into Tier Three of Covid-19 restrictions at midnight along with parts of Essex and Hertfordshire, shutting all pubs, restaurants and entertainment venues indefinitely.

item.title: It's beginning to look a lot like Christmas PANIC! Sea of shoppers flood Oxford Street and West End
item.description: Shoppers lined up in front of upmarket outlets such as Hermes and Louis Vuitton central London's Oxford Street as well heeled customers emerged with huge gift bags (pictured).

item.title: Boris Johnson says Christmas gift to Nicola Sturgeon is Brexit fish
item.description: Boris Johnson today said his Christmas gift to Nicola Sturgeon is the 'hundreds of thousands of tonnes of fish' Scotland will become the 'proud possessor of' in the New Year because of Brexit.

item.title: Army chef, 40, left with chronic pain says MoD left him too cold
item.description: Randy Constable, 40, says he has been left with chronic pain in his hands and feet after suffering non-freezing cold injuries while cooking meals on a winter tour of duty in Afghanistan.

item.title: Vertigo sufferer has his family in stitches as he takes a virtual reality fairground ride
item.description: Paul Best from Bodmin, Cornwall, donned the £299 Oculus Rift and started a virtual ride on a rollercoaster, which left him grunting and groaning from the computer generated experience.

item.title: Father of schoolboy, 12, 'murdered by 14-year-old' on village green refuses to 'judge' the accused
item.description: Roberts Buncis' body was found in Fishtoft, Boston, Lincolnshire on Saturday. A 14-year-old boy, who cannot be named for legal reasons, was charged with his murder and appeared in court on Monday.

item.title: Coroner records air pollution exposure as cause of death for first time
item.description: Ella Kissi-Debrah, from London, died in February 2013 after suffering numerous seizures and making almost 30 visits to hospital with breathing problems over the previous three years.

item.title: Baggage handler, 36, who stamped British Airways hostess lover, 58, to death is jailed for life
item.description: Jayesh Gobar, 36, was convicted by a jury at Hove Crown Court of the murder of 58-year-old Nelly Myers at her home in Rotherfield, near Crowborough, East Sussex, on December 17 last year.

item.title: Hand-written maths lessons that Dambusters hero Barnes Wallis used to woo his wife, 17, up for sale
item.description: Barnes Wallis fell for much younger cousin Molly Bloxham in the 1920s, but her father felt it was inappropriate for her senior suitor, who was almost 20 years older, to be writing to her.

item.title: Case against Marco Pierre White Jr for stealing £40 Nokia phone from his father's hotel is dropped
item.description: The case against Marco Pierre White Jnr (pictured, today) was dropped after it was revealed the manager of the Rudloe Arms Hotel near Bath no longer wished to press charges.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell has been entrusted with monitoring other inmates who may be suicidal
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell has reportedly been made a 'suicide watch inmate' at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn where she is being held until trial, her lawyers claimed in a newly unsealed filing.

item.title: Animal RAM-page! Goat, sheep and three lambs cause chaos after running wild in Turkish town hall
item.description: CCTV footage shared on social media shows a sheep, goat and three lambs raiding Nevsehir City Hall and chasing officials in southeast Turkey at around 8.24am on Monday.

item.title: Germany begins its Christmas coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Germany's new 'hard lockdown', replacing a six-week 'lockdown light' which failed to bring the second wave under control, will see shops and schools closed until January.

item.title: Moment 'medically exempt' easyJet passenger is accused of 'causing disruption' for not wearing mask
item.description: Lydia Rutter suffers from anxiety and says she is exempt from wearing a face mask but was 'harassed' by easyJet crew on a flight into Manchester when she failed to produce a medical certificate.

item.title: Bitcoin breaks above $20,000 for first time
item.description: Bitcoin's value has been buoyed by hopes that it will become a mainstream payment method, especially after PayPal said it would allow its US account holders to use it.

item.title: Sacked PwC accountant drunkenly groped a sleeping woman's breasts aboard BA flight
item.description: James Phipps, from the Isle of Wight, was on a transatlantic flight when he rubbed the breasts of a female passenger two seats away from him and tried to kiss her, a disciplinary hearing heard.

item.title: Margaret Thatcher's biographer says The Crown didn't capture the Prime Minister's 'humanity'
item.description: Margaret Thatcher's biographer Charles Moore has claimed on the Chopper's Politics podcast that Netflix drama The Crown does not capture the Prime Minister's 'humanity'.

item.title: Facebook takes advantage of Brexit to move all UK users onto US privacy agreements
item.description: Facebook will shift all its users in the UK into user agreements with the corporate headquarters in California, moving them out of their current relationship with Facebook's Irish unit.

item.title: Prickly proposition! Urban fox tips over a hedgehog who was stealing its food
item.description: Simon Woodley filmed the incident at his home in Sunderland last week.He said he often leaves out an egg for the urban fox who is a regular visitor to his garden.

item.title: Sweet factory worker, 50 is jailed for 30 years for trying to murder six fellow staff
item.description: Andrew Wrigglesworth, from Birstall, West Yorkshire, deliberately drove into his colleagues in a 'horrendous' and 'barely conceivable' attack while at the wheel of his red soft-top Audi A4.

item.title: UN aid agency Unicef will help feed BRITISH children for the first time in its history after Covid
item.description: Unicef will help feed children left in difficulty as a result of the coronavirus crisis by providing food boxes to families. It is the first time in Unicef's 70 year history it has helped feed children in the UK.

item.title: Clean up begins after Londoners hit pubs and bars before Tier 3
item.description: Bin bags were piled up on street corners while recycling containers were full of glass bottles following a last hurrah for many Londoners with their friends before Christmas.

item.title: Carer is SACKED for filming morale-boosting Beyoncé music video while dressed in PPE
item.description: Michelle Cooper, 55, from Helston, Cornwall, a care team leader, decided to film the funny skit of her team dancing to Beyonce's Single Ladies outside her home to raise the spirits of her colleagues.

item.title: Boyfriend proposes to his train driver girlfriend as she pulls into Dublin platform
item.description: Train driver Paula Carbo Zea said she was 'surprised and at the same time excited' after she saw her boyfriend Conor waiting for her at the end of the platform in Pearse Street in Dublin last night.

item.title: Amazon series The Pack criticized by PETA after leaked footage shows dogs rappel off a CLIFF
item.description: In episode three of The Pack, set in Costa Rica, the blue team are tasked with rappelling down the 108ft Los Campesinos Falls, tethered to their canine companions.

item.title: Expressions: People around the world pull the same faces in similar social settings
item.description: Experts from the US used artificial intelligence to analyse the faces seen in 6 million YouTube videos - broadly finding similar expressions in similar social settings.

item.title: UK weather: Britain is told to brace for floods with 108 warnings and alerts in place
item.description: Up to two inches (50mm) of rain could fall today, and a further 2.4 inches (60mm) from tomorrow evening to Saturday. The worst-affected areas are likely to be South Wales and the West Country.

item.title: Boris Johnson plots overhaul of shipping regulations to turn London into the Singapore of the West
item.description: Proposals have been drawn up to revamp UK shipping tax laws to allow more vessels to be classified as ships in a move ministers believe will raise up to £3.75billion over three years.

item.title: Duke and Duchess of Cambridge boast the most popular Instagram posts of 2020 out of the Royal Family
item.description: Prince William and Kate, both 38, who share their photographs on the Kensington Royal page, secured the two top liked snaps in 2020, according to Twitter account Gert's Royals.

item.title: The players Manchester City, Manchester United, Spurs and Liverpool must sign in January
item.description: Fixture congestion, player fatigue, injuries and a wide-open race for the 2021 Premier League title means the need to spend big in the January transfer window has never been greater.

item.title: Vintage Bugatti that's been missing for HALF A CENTURY to sell for £7million
item.description: The car had been kept in a private collection in North Straffordshire since 1969 in 'exceptionally original condition'. It has since been made available for sale following the recent death of the last owner.

item.title: Downing Street defends Dominic Cummings' pay rise
item.description: Downing Street today defended Dominic Cummings' pay rise of at least £40,000 and insisted his salary was at the 'correct level'.

item.title: Building sector has 'moved away and not towards' climate change goals: UN
item.description: Construction and operation of buildings accounted for more than a third of global carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions last year, a new UN report reveals.

item.title: Publisher cancels Julie Burchill's book contract after 'Islamophobic' Twitter row
item.description: Julie Birchill's book, Welcome to the Woke Trials: How #Identity killed progressive politics, was due to be released in March but has now been dropped by publisher Little, Brown.

item.title: PornHub owner MindGeek sued for $80 million by 40 women who say the site profited from GirlsDoPorn
item.description: In a complaint filed Tuesday in California, alleged victims say MindGeek 'knew it was profiting from a sex trafficking venture' GirlsDoPorn owner Michael Pratt is inset.

item.title: Solihull sister pays tribute to brother and his wife killed when Mercedes crashed into wall
item.description: Aleah Khan said Kyle Khan, 26, and Meesha Afzal, 22, (pictured, the couple) meant the 'whole world to her' following the early hours crash in Solihull on Sunday.

item.title: Tories hail U-turn on 'mutant algorithm' after shires planning revolt
item.description: Housing Secretary Robert Jenrick confirmed that the methodology being used by councils to draw up local plans is being 'updated' following a furious backlash.

item.title: Purrfect harmony! Guitarist performs a 'jazz' duet with his piano-playing ginger cat Barney
item.description: The video, which has been shared widely on TikTok features Marsel Gilmanov and his ginger cat playing an unusual duet at their home in Moscow, Russia which has been viewed by almost 300,000 people.

item.title: Number of public sector workers earning more than £150,000 rises by 6%
item.description: Some 552 public sector workers had packages worth more than the threshold in the latest list released by the government.

item.title: Cheating husband, 42, and mistress, 30, used morphine to drug his wife's drink
item.description: Richard Gell, 42, from Filey, North Yorkshire, planned to use her fingerprint to unlock her his wife's phone to see if she and another man had exchanged messages after she was knocked out.

item.title: Heathrow third runway will go ahead: Airport wins Supreme Court challenge
item.description: A panel of five justices at the UK's highest court allowed Heathrow Airport to expand by building the controversial third runway after the Court of Appeal declared the plans were unlawful.

item.title: Kate Middleton dons £95 nautical navy striped top to send best wishes to Ben Ainslie
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge, 38, showed her love for literal dressing yesterday as she donned a £95 nautical striped top to send her best wishes to Ben Ainslie's crew in a video message.

item.title: Fourth man appears in court over Battersea killing of Real Housewives of Cheshire star's brother
item.description: Flamur 'Alex' Beqiri, 36, was shot in front of his wife Debora Krasniqi and young child on the doorstep of his £1.5million family home in Battersea, southwest London on Christmas Eve last year.

item.title: Brexit supporter who was jailed for harassing ex-MP appears in court accused of breaking Covid rules
item.description: A protester jailed for harassing former MP Anna Soubry has appeared in court accused of Covid breaches - insisting the virus was 'made up' and her 'real world trumps your fantasy'.

item.title: Premier League footballers are asked if they want to STOP taking the knee by the PFA
item.description: The survey sent out to all Premier League, EFL and Women's Super League clubs includes questions on whether the pre-match gesture should be carried on in support of black lives and anti-racism.

item.title: Heart-stopping moment TWO cars miss being pummelled by 40mph train by half a SECOND
item.description: Two cars can be seen driving across the Norwich Road level crossing, near New Rackheath, Norfolk as the a train approaches.

item.title: Iranian President Rouhani says he is happy 'lawless terrorist' Trump is leaving office
item.description: 'We are not overjoyed about Mr. Biden's arrival, but we are happy about Trump leaving,' Rouhani said in Tehran, adding the Republican was 'the most lawless U.S. president' and a 'terrorist.'

item.title: Hungary writes 'the mother is a woman, the father is a man' into its constitution
item.description: Hungary's MPs yesterday voted in favour of a change to the country's constitution defining a child's sex as that assigned to them at birth. The country also banned same-sex adoption.

item.title: Jeff Bezos's ex-wife MacKenzie Scott says she has given $4.1 billion to charity
item.description: MacKenzie Scott, philanthropist, author and former wife of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, has announced that she has given away $4.1billion in the past four months to hundreds of organizations.

item.title: Crime family's 63-year-old mother kept machine gun, hand grenade and Glock pistol in her wardrobe
item.description: Officers raided three properties in Newcastle where they found the illegal weapons including a hand grenade and drugs in a sweeping national crackdown on serious and organised crime.

item.title: Apple donated more than 40 MILLION face masks and shields to healthcare workers during the pandemic
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Exact breakdowns of where the PPE has been distributed remains unknown but it is believed frontline workers globally received items throughout 2020.

item.title: Excited golden retriever slides along icy road to deliver tree branch gift to his owner
item.description: The eight-month-old golden retriever called 'Cake' is seen in trending footage with the twig in his mouth while trying to run towards his owner before sliding on the icy road in Guizhou, China.

item.title: People from around the world share examples of things they've seen but cannot explain
item.description: People from across the globe have taken to Reddit to share their tales of ghostly encounters and unexplained happenings that could be proof of the supernatural.

item.title: Palm Beach residents demand town ban Trump from moving to Mar-a-Lago
item.description: An attorney representing the DeMoss family, which lives right next door to Mar-a-Lago, want the town of Palm Beach, Florida, to deny President Trump permission to permanently settle there.

item.title: Dad who FORGOT wife and kids after being attacked on Christmas Eve is still recovering a year later
item.description: Ian Grimes, 40, was left with severe brain injuries after he was punched to the ground by a random attacker while walking back to his home near Ellesmere Port, Cheshire, last December 24.

item.title: Rorke's Drift photos show scene of Zulu battle in 1879
item.description: Chard led the 150-strong British garrison in repelling 4,000 Zulu warriors during the battle, soon after British imperial forces had invaded Zululand to tighten their grip on South Africa.

item.title: Sales of retro decorations have boomed this Christmas
item.description: Demand for retro 70s, 80s and 90s decorations has boomed this Christmas, with interest in original vintage goods at double last year's levels.

item.title: Meghan Markle has adopted a 'presidential and persuasive' voice
item.description: British behaviour expert Judi James suggested the couple's trailer, released yesterday, showed Meghan using 'persuasive' techniques to convince her husband to take the lead.

item.title: Over 300 passengers are stranded on ferry overnight after six crew members test positive for Covid
item.description: Passengers on the Stena Line ferry from Liverpool to Belfast were stranded after six crew tested positive for Covid-19 before the vessel departed. A further 15 have been told to self-isolate.

item.title: 'Stay local and book early,' transport tsar tells Christmas travellers as he rules out train chaos
item.description: Network Rail chairman Sir Peter Hendy suggested people should 'stay local' during the festive period, even though the train network is not expecting 'terrible scenes' at stations and in carriages.

item.title: Simon Cowell proves he's on the road to recovery as he rides a jet ski in Barbados
item.description: The music mogul, 61, was in good spirits as he sped through the ocean with his son and Lauren, who highlighted her svelte physique in a gorgeous white bikini.

item.title: World Health Organization urges families to wear face masks at Christmas get-togethers
item.description: In updated guidance published today, the WHO warned that Europe was teetering on the brink of a third wave of Covid-19, which could peak in the first weeks of the new year.

item.title: One in 10 suffer from 'long Covid' three months after recovering
item.description: The Office for National Statistics looked at 8,193 Britons who had tested positive for Covid between April and the start of December. It revealed that 9.9 per cent of people had symptoms 12 weeks later.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell 'gave £15m to husband to protect her fortune from claims by Epstein victims'
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is said to have transferred £15million to her husband Scott Borgerson after they married which could protect her wealth from being claimed by alleged victims of Epstein.

item.title: Yorkshire Shepherdess setting bar 'suitably low' for Christmas
item.description: Yorkshire Shepherdess Amanda Owen, 45,has revealed on This Morning today her plans for a low-key Christmas which will see her nine kids undertake all of their normal farm chores.

item.title: Is a LEOPARD on the hunt in a tiny Wiltshire village? Photo appears to show deadly big cat
item.description: The large spotted feline was seen hunched below a grass burrow in a park in Codford in Wiltshire, but some locals claim it is not a real leopard - but is instead a toy or an ornament.

item.title: National Trust accused of 'bias' over team investigating ties of properties to slave trade
item.description: The Colonial Countryside project is looking at 11 country houses managed by the National Trust in England and investigating their links to Africa, the Caribbean and India.

item.title: Laura Whitmore and Iain Stirling having a baby
item.description: The Love Island presenter took to Instagram on Wednesday to reveal the happy news, a day after it was revealed she and Iain Stirling had married in secret.

item.title: Queen Mary's dolls' house dining set to fetch up to £30,000 at auction
item.description: A miniature dining set designed for Queen Mary's dolls' house is expected to fetch £30,000 at auction when it goes on sale in London next month.

item.title: Fascinating graphs reveal how highly infectious diseases were all-but wiped out by vaccines
item.description: Fascinating graphs have revealed how three highly infectious and deadly diseases - smallpox, measles and polio - were all-but wiped out after vaccines were developed to fight them.

item.title: Top TIER! Petrol heads snub social distancing as £2m supercar fleet causes chaos in central London
item.description: Souped up Lamborghinis worth £250,000, BMW M5s costing over £100,00 and flashy Porsches lined up on New Bond Street as youngsters showed off their rides.

item.title: Police record more than 2,000 honour crimes in last year including 140 victims of forced marriage
item.description: Police forces have been required to report honour crime figures to the Home Office since April last year. The first report shows 74 were female genital mutilation while 140 were forced marriage.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Hypocrite Harry and wife Meghan's Radio Woke podcast parody
item.description: PIERS MORGAN: It's almost impossible to parody their whimpering, giggling, cringe-making load of old guff in the Spotify trailer. But I'm going to try.

item.title: Fury as photographer who snapped model wife's neck released early from Russian prison
item.description: Russian prosecutors are appealing the decision to free Dmitry Loshagin , 44, who killed his wife Yulia Loshagina's, 26, after serving just six years in prison in Yekaterinburg, Russia.

item.title: House prices reach record high of £245k in October 2020 says ONS
item.description: While the property market surge continues, it stands in contrast to the floundering wider economy, and a growing number of experts think house prices are on track to fall next year.

item.title: Laurence Fox has boozy Christmas dinner 'business meeting' with Reclaim party colleagues
item.description: Laurence Fox held a Christmas dinner business meeting with colleagues from his Reclaim party on the last day of Tier 2 - complete with £195 bottle of champagne.

item.title: Parents vow to take legal action over death of 11-month-old daughter after 'gross failure'
item.description: Sophie Burgess was given a lethal amount of phenytoin at St Peter's Hospital in Chertsey, Surrey, despite the complaints of a nurse who said it was unnecessary and against protocol.

item.title: Salon forced to close over ad saying it will charge £5 extra for children with 'additional needs'
item.description: PJ's Hairdressing Group opened Krazy Kids salon in Somerset. Its booking page urged parents to 'book extra time' for children with special needs and a leaflet showed an extra £5 charge.

item.title: The Scrooge who stole the GRINCH at Christmas! Thief is caught on CCTV walking off with a 7ft Grinch
item.description: CCTV footage reveals the moment a real-life Scrooge steals a homemade, 7ft, Grinch mannequin from outside family's home at Cannock, Staffordshire.

item.title: Fitness model, 35, response to trolls who've criticised her postpartum body
item.description: Emily Skye, 35, who lives in Australia, with daughter Mia, two, and partner Declan Redmond, penned a heartfelt response to trolls who claim she's 'ruined' her body since birth of baby Izaac in June.

item.title: Hennessey reveals its 311mph Top Gun-style supercar
item.description: The $2.7m, or £2m, US supercar has key parts supplied from Britain and is the first built from scratch to carry the name of the legendary John Hennessey.

item.title: Peter Pan author JM Barrie's home in unspoilt village goes up for sale for £950,000
item.description: The famous novelist is known to have spent summers at Beechwood, in the unspoilt Scottish village of Strathtay in Highland Perthshire, and is understood to have rented the period property.

item.title: Parents reveal three sons all have 'catastrophic' muscle wasting disease
item.description: Paula and Padraig Naughton, of County Roscommon, whose sons all have Duchenne muscular dystrophy appeared on Good Morning Britain today.

item.title: Girl, 9, demands AirPods, a live PANDA and a trip to France in hilarious letter to Santa
item.description: The nine-year-old, from Essex, included a staggering 12 gifts she expects to discover on Christmas day - such as a snake, a Nintendo Switch, a PlayStation Four and Five as well as a laptop.

item.title: Mother carries 'murdered' British one-year-old girl into hotel lobby and pleads for help
item.description: Shocking newly-revealed CCTV footage shows Madina Barakat, 23, carrying herdaughter Sophia, one, through the InterContinental Hotel lobby in Almaty, Kazakhstan.

item.title: Warming: Update to global temperature dataset reveals it was hotter last decade than thought
item.description: Experts from the Met Office and the University of East Anglia have released the latest refinement of the HadCRUT temperature dataset, which stretches back to 1850.

item.title: Pictured: Two-year-old daughter 'killed by her NHS worker mother, 25' who 'then took her own life'
item.description: Hospital staff last night told of their sadness after an NHS worker Shiwangi Bagoan allegedly killed her daughter Ziana (pictured together) before taking her own life in west London suspected murder-suicide.

item.title: Experts slam the use of forehead-scanning thermometers to screen for Covid-19
item.description: Dr William Wright at the Johns Hopkins University and Dr Philip Mackowiak at the University of Maryland have rubbished claims the devices are an effective tool in preventing Covid-19.

item.title: Swedish health advisers misjudged the resurgence of Covid-19, PM says
item.description: The PM's criticism came as Sweden's no-lockdown approach, championed by state epidemiologist Anders Tegnell, was blamed in part for the high death toll in care homes during the first wave.

item.title: Armed counter-terror police to board London buses and patrol bus stops in bid to thwart attacks
item.description: The Met's roads and transport unit has formed a new counter-terror team which will see specialist officers backed by armed police and sniffer dogs patrol key locations in the city.

item.title: Edward Enninful says he's 'honoured' to be promoted to Vogue's European editorial director
item.description: Edward Enninful, 48, from London, has taken to Instagram to reveal he feels 'honoured' after being promoted to Vogue's European editorial director.

item.title: Ethnic minorities 'are more reluctant to take the coronavirus vaccine'
item.description: Confidence in a Covid-19 vaccine was lowest among respondents of Asian ethnicity, with 55 per cent likely to say yes to a jab, according to polling for the Royal Society for Public Health.

item.title: MI6 failed to tell ministers when 'high-risk' secret agent 'crossed red lines' overseas
item.description: M16 failed to tell Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab or his predecessor Jeremy Hunt that a 'high risk' agent had likely engaged in 'serious crime' overseas when seeking renewal for his foreign authorisation.

item.title: Couple move in together during lockdown after just ONE date
item.description: In last night's episode of Channel 4's The Year That Changed Love, Claire, 31, and Jade, 27, from Edinburgh, told how they chose to go into isolation together after one date.

item.title: Gangland kingpin, 32, is jailed for 12 years for masterminding UK-wide gun running racket
item.description: Aqdas Vasi was arrested in Manchester after Tyrece Weaver was assigned to make a 360 mile round trip by taxi to collect the 19th century weapon for use by County Lines gangsters in Stevenage.

item.title: Airlines being investigated by competition watchdog
item.description: The Competition and Markets Authority said its probe will look at situations where airlines continued to operate flights despite people being unable lawfully to travel for non-essential purposes.

item.title: Airline safety concerns over planes being reactivated after storage during pandemic
item.description: 'Rusty' pilots returning to work and insect nests in planes have been raised as potential problems for airlines as they restart business and take jets out of storage after the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Hong Kong civil servants swear oaths of loyalty to China-backed government
item.description: Hong Kong's chief executive Carrie Lam oversaw a closed-door ceremony in which a group of senior officials took the pledge on Wednesday (pictured, civil servants taking the oath).

item.title: Is Vladimir Putin the mystery owner of new £200million palace?
item.description: A palatial new 91,500sqft home has appeared on the edge of a luxury estate near Moscow, leading to speculation about the owner - which is officially listed as the 'Russian Federation'.

item.title: Inflation drops to 0.3% as clothing and food prices eased during lockdown
item.description: The headline CPI rate was down from 0.7 per cent in October, taking some of the pressure off families struggling with economic meltdown.

item.title: Five words that turn high-quality men off, according to an elegance coach
item.description: London -based elegance coach Anna Bey, 34, claimed most men would prefer not to be called 'my little baby' or 'my little boy' because it reminded them of their mother.

item.title: Hilarious pictures of dogs looking like something else
item.description: Dog lovers from the US and US have shared photos of their pets as part of the #LookAlikeChallenge - with the best examples collated in a Bored Panda gallery.

item.title: Tracey Cox reveals why the four biggest danger points for couples are often the most innocent
item.description: Sexpert Tracey Cox reveals the four most challenging times in every relationship, including include significant days such as Christmas, milestone birthdays and life-changing events.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... London in lockdown
item.description: 'Let's give it a miss - the streets are paved with face masks and all the pubs are shut'

item.title: Covid-19 restrictions have been used to destroy civil liberties around the world, rights groups warn
item.description: Authorities in China (pictured) have adopted extremely coercive measures, while in France people had to fill out paperwork before leaving their homes during two lockdowns.

item.title: London pubs sell beers for 99p hours before the capital is plunged into Tier 3
item.description: Hospitality bosses slammed 'catastrophic' decision to move London and parts of the home counties into Tier 3 as they warned of mass job losses and £2.7bn wiped off the economy.

item.title: Rising number of Covid-19 cases are set to dash hopes of locked down areas being given more freedom
item.description: Boris Johnson had raised the hopes of some MPs that their areas would move down a tier on the first review date when he originally set out the plans for the controversial system across the country.

item.title: Minister urges families to do 'minimum' in Christmas bubbles
item.description: The seriousness of the situation facing the PM was underlined as daily cases hit 18,450, up 50 per cent on last Tuesday, although deaths were down.

item.title: HALF of Rishi Sunak's £42billion Covid business loans 'being hoarded in firms' bank accounts'
item.description: Some £21billion - half of the total £42billion doled out by Rishi Sunak under various schemes - has yet to be used by the businesses that claimed it, representatives of UK banks said.

item.title: Unemployment spikes to 4.9 per cent in latest quarter
item.description: The jobless rate rose in the three months to October, hitting a level 0.7 percentage points higher than the previous quarter.

item.title: Sweden's Icehotel reveals its new one-of-a-kind suites for 2021
item.description: Each year since 1989, the Icehotel has been built and rebuilt using just snow and ice in the village of Jukkasjarvi, 125 miles north of the Arctic Circle next to the shores of the Torne River.
